head.supplied: Melbourne bot Garden ¶ 25/10/64 ¶ Dear Dr Anderson. ¶ ¶ I received from Conferenzrath Prof Dr Rafn of Copenhagen, a venerable friend of mine, a number of large letters accompanied by papers relating ...

div.p: Royal Botanic Garden Edinburgh, Thomas Anderson, box 2, letters from various originators 1859-68, vol. 1, no.155.

I received from Conferenzrath Prof Dr Rafn of Copenhagen, a venerable friend of mine, a number of large letters accompanied by papers relating to the Royal Danish Archaeologic Society for transmission to India. I have taken the liberty of forwarding the whole to you, begging to effect the final transmission or should you feel difficulty in doing so pray ask the Babon Rajendralal Mitra of Calcutta or Meerza Ali Mahomed Khan of Bombay to be so friendly to despatch the parcels. Both these Gentlemen are connected with the Scandinavian Society of Antiquarians.

Would you be so friendly to give me a line of acknowledgement, so that I may show to Prof Rafn that the parcels have reached India.
No letter of acknowledgement has been found.
I have several publications & some plants to send to your Garden & Herbarium, but the pressure of work prevented me affecting the transit by this steamer.

font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd. Mueller
On the final sheet of this letter is a letter dated 30 November 1864 from J. Anderson to 'My dear Tom' reporting that he has 'attended to the contents' of this and another letter; the letter also contains domestic news.
